content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 7 x minus x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the line <math alttext="y equals 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

choices.label: <math alttext="50 minus, the fraction 175 over 2, end fraction, plus, the fraction 125 over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 175 over 2, end fraction, minus, the fraction 117 over 3, end fraction, minus 44" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>117</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mn>44</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 175 over 2, end fraction, minus, the fraction 109 over 3, end fraction, minus 38" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>109</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 175 over 2, end fraction, minus, the fraction 125 over 3, end fraction, plus 50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 175 over 2, end fraction, minus, the fraction 109 over 3, end fraction, minus 38" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>109</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
